Crimes.Legal_Issue: Credibility of claimant's testimony and documents
Crimes.Application_Facts: RPD found contradictions in Jamil's testimony and documents but misinterpreted key details
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Refugee claim rejected due to perceived lack of credibility
Crimes.Court_Ruling: Federal Court allowed judicial review, set aside RPD decision
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Fear of persecution upon return to Bangladesh
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Credibility assessment based on document inconsistencies
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Standard of review for RPD decisions
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: RPD disbelieved Jamil due to alleged inconsistencies
Crimes.Application_Basis: Asylum claim based on political opinion and fear of persecution
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Credibility findings must not be patently unreasonable
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: Minor discrepancies exaggerated; explanations dismissed without justification
Crimes.Outcome: Judicial review allowed, case remitted for redetermination
Crimes.Decisional_Body: Immigration and Refugee Board - Refugee Protection Division (IRB-RPD)
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Risk of persecution if returned to Bangladesh
Crimes.Cause_Description: Rejection based on unreasonable credibility findings regarding document inconsistencies
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Violated: Not applicable – no finding of actual document forgery
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: Misinterpretation of minor inconsistencies as major contradictions
Crimes.Residency_Compliance: Claimant lawfully in Canada at time of claim
Crimes.Misrepresentation_Element: Alleged but not proven; based on credibility
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: Federal Court jurisdiction over IRB decisions
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Insufficient basis for discrediting claim due to minor issues
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Failure to consider substance of fear and contextual explanations

Crimes.Crime_Name: Misrepresentation under Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether RPD made perverse or capricious credibility findings
Crimes.Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, s. 18.1(4)(d) Federal Courts Act
Crimes.Outcome: Refugee claim initially rejected, then set aside on judicial review
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: RPD found inconsistencies in political activities and detention history
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Personal information form (PIF), proof of exit (POE), oral testimony
Crimes.Legal_Provision: Section 18.1(4)(d) of the Federal Courts Act
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Fear of persecution due to political opinion and past detention
Crimes.Proceeding_Type: Refugee protection hearing and subsequent judicial review
Crimes.Application_Error: RPD failed to properly assess minor discrepancies in context
Crimes.Review_Outcome: Judicial review allowed, decision set aside
Crimes.Assessment_Standard: Perverse or capricious interpretation of facts
Crimes.Evidence_Ignored: Substance of fear and plausible explanations for discrepancies
Crimes.Application_Factor: Consistency between testimony and documentary evidence
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Claim rejected by RPD, overturned on review
Crimes.Outcome_of_Review: Remitted for redetermination by new RPD panel
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Perceived inconsistencies in account of political involvement and detention
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Misinterpretation of minor inconsistencies as material falsehoods
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Concerns about adequate consideration of claimant’s explanations
Crimes.Document_Fraud: Not alleged; issue was misrepresentation through inconsistency
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Judicial review challenging reasonableness of RPD decision
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Standard of review in administrative law
Crimes.Omission_Type: Inconsistent reporting of timeline and events
